Draw a line from point (0.4062, 0.2031) to point (0.4062, 0.438) 3. Draw a line from point (0.4062, 0.438) to point (0.3778, 0.4232) 4. Close the loop by drawing a line from point (0.3778, 0.4232) to point (0.3778, 0.2031) **Sketch Face 3** 1. Draw a line from point (0.5151, 0.0) to point (0.75, 0.0) 2. Draw a line from point (0.75, 0.0) to point (0.75, 0.4062) 3. Draw a line from point (0.75, 0.4062) to point (0.5151, 0.4062) 4. Close the loop by drawing a line from point (0.5151, 0.4062) to point (0.5151, 0.0) After sketching, create a 3D sketch by scaling the 2D sketch by 0.75 and then apply the Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 3D sketch with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.1642 - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: Create a new solid body The length of the final part is approximately 0.75; the width 0.1642; the height 0.75.</description>
